These compounds can lead to a rounded mouthfeel, full bodiness, pleasant aroma, and perceptible sweetness. 





 

Team & Experience 
Owner and cidermaker at Menacing Fog Cider, Khalid El, began making hard cider innocently in his S.F. apartment in 2013. Since then his skills and methods have been shaped primarily by curiosity and love of process, and have been bolstered by experiences such coursework and training in hard cider making at Peter Mitchell’s Cider and Perry Making Academy in Washington, experience making delicious coffee for 3 years as a barista at Blue Bottle Coffee, and working wine harvests in 2013 with Knez Wines in California and in 2014 with Love & Squalor Wines in Oregon.

 



 Why We Need Your Help & Funding GoalsWe could use your help to inspire our vision of getting the experience of drinking naturally crafted hard cider to more people and change the way that hard cider is made and thought of. Our hope is to raise upwards of $5000 to move us towards our annual goal of producing and selling 1500 gallons of hard cider. This amount will be used to purchase more apple juice ($1500) and fermentation containers/kegs ($1900), secure appropriate operational licenses ($900), and create our website ($700). Whatever we raise beyond $5K will be put to good use, as well! We will use the additional contributions to boost our brand awareness by participating in hard cider and craft beverage festivals, solicit sound business advising to promote our growth and aspire towards our own cidery, attend advanced hard cider making courses to ensure that every batch of hard cider reaches our ever evolving high standards, and expand the scope of our website to include an exciting subscription-based offering. About Our PerksWe have some wonderful perks that will give you an opportunity to taste our delicious and unique hard cider and that will set you up with hard cider drinking accessories. Check them out!Note: Hard cider and tasting vouchers redeemable for physical​ ​delivery or in-cidery​ ​pick-up ONLY (in and ​around the San Francisco/Bay Area, California). Contact us at menacingfogcider@gmail.com with any delivery questions or comments.  Risks and ChallengesProducing a distinct, high quality hard cider without manipulations, i.e., adding sulphites and other additives, while avoiding or resolving the plethora of potential issues that may arise from wild yeast and bacteria (which we embrace) is no easy feat; however, we believe our mentioned experiences will allow us to meet the challenges and reap the rewards of making cider, albeit the hard way!P.S. All funds regardless of outcome will be used to achieve Menacing Fog Cider business goals.Thank you!Khalid El Menacing Fog Cider

story:
Keep Your Wallet and Your Guts Happy with Great Recipes, Kitchen Hacks,

Money Saving Tips, Tips on Cooking for Dietary Restrictions, and Cool Techniques!

“A three course meal made on 2 hotplates and a toaster oven.”

I grew up watching my mother cook and wanting to be just like her. Her passion for food was infectious. I started cooking when i was 13 years old, and even then I had a tendency to modify the recipes that I was being taught. It was those first experiments that led to my very first coveted recipe - shepherd’s pie.

In my first year of university, frustrated with the monotony of cafeteria food on campus and student-poor, I created three course meals for me and my dorm-mates including once when I made a Greek salad with homemade dressing, braised beef with gravy, kluski (Polish Potato dumplings), and had some muffins baking for breakfast. All of which was prepared using 2 hotplates and a toaster oven. 

When I was diagnosed with Crohn's, what was already a honed enthusiasm for food, turned into an obsession. My body became extremely picky about what I could and couldn't eat. Many preservatives turned out to be pain triggers and I became extremely sensitive to taste, smell, and texture. I became adept at modifying recipes to make them work with my strict Crohn's diet and to reduce my IBS pain. 

In addition to having to deal with many diet restrictions, disability-imposed poverty meant that I had to operate within a relatively tight budget. Saving money became as important as making sure that I didn't set off or worsen flares. I learned how to preserve food while it was cheapest without the use of those preservatives or higher acidity that contribute to pain. 

Over the years I had picked up a variety of skills as I worked both on finding recipes to accommodate my Crohn’s diet and to recreate some of my childhood favorites, including:  

  • Canning and Pickling food
  • Making my own spices and spice mixes
  • Important basics like stocks, sauces, marinades, and dressings. 
  • Breaking down a whole chicken, a whole beef tenderloin, and so forth.

For a while now, my friends have been begging me to put together a cookbook.I want to write one that includes recipes of course, but also includes instructions on how to do fun things in the kitchen. 

  • Learn how to make and modify recipes to accommodate different dietary restrictions. How to make different treats from scratch in order to control the ingredients that get used.
  • Learn how to take advantage of local and summer produce to help save you money all year round.  
  • Learn how to make the most of your ingredients and make sure little or nothing goes to waste. How to use parts that are usually discarded to add additional flavor to your dishes. 
  • Learn how to take advantage of high energy days to make meals ahead of time for when you are too tired to cook and can't afford to eat out. How to safely freeze and reheat ready-made meals, ingredients, and so much more. 

This cookbook will have something for everyone! 

  • Great recipes for anyone looking for fun new meal ideas
  • Lessons in different kitchen techniques to improve your cooking abilities
  • Tips on how to make Crohn's, IBD, and IBS friendly meals, and how to modify recipes to fit dietary restrictions - including tips on modifying recipes to make them lactose-free, dairy-free, gluten-free, and even occasionally vegetarian.
  • Tips on how to save money.  


THE RUB?

I am on disability, and my wife just graduated from her Ph.D and is currently unemployed. We barely have money for regular groceries and bills, let alone the sheer amount of ingredients needed to remake all the recipes in a short period of time - including while some of them are out of season. 

I need to make them again in order to add pictures to the cookbook. I also usually cook by eye, and need to work on translating instinct into exact measurements.

THE MENU OF GOALS:

$500 – The Basic Cookbook

This is the base amount I need in order to be able to purchase all the ingredients needed to make all of these recipes. It should enable me to take a series of pictures of the process with my phone. I will include as many different techniques that I can. I will provide instructions for people on how to modify recipes to make them work for their own dietary restrictions. The goal being to help people with Crohn's and other IBDs to be able to eat delicious food despite their digestive issues. 

The Perk: I will publish an eBook through Amazon.

Stretch Goal the First - $750 – Put A Little Sausage In It! Also Cheese?

I have all the necessary equipment, but making sausage, and bacon, and cheese requires some extras that can get pricey as they add up. The extra money will let me play with sausage recipes, make homemade bacon and culture cheeses other than ricotta, which in turn will help me with providing more options on how to modify recipes and existing foods to fit dietary restrictions.  By teaching people how to make their own sausages I hope to help people be able to create great "going out" foods. Help people with Crohn's and Dietary restrictions be able to join in on the campfire roasts, the bbq's and other social events. 

The Perk: All of these recipes and techniques will then be included in the book, for your own experimentation. In addition, I will record the adventure process on my blog for all to enjoy.

ADDITIONAL PERK: If I reach this level I will publish one recipe a week on my blog until I finish writing the cookbook. 

Stretch Goal the Second - $1000 – Watch The Sausage Get Made.

With that little extra help, I will be able to afford to get a camera as well as other equipment, and even potentially acquire a dedicated space I can use to show various recipe-making techniques on video. That’s right: in addition to a written cookbook, the extended goal will make it possible for me to start a video cookbook as well! This will in turn help people who can't afford a cookbook or have trouble learning from written pages. It will allow me to demonstrate things for people in a way that is accessible to a greater number of people. 

The Perk: In addition to writing and publishing the cookbook, I will make videos of all of the recipes one by one. This will give me the opportunity to show some of the skills I will do my best to describe in the cookbook.

ADDITIONAL PERK: If I reach this level, I will publish one rough video of some cool technique or recipe before the end of November. 

Stretch Goal the Third -$1500 – Put Me On The Shelf.

While I will be able to arrange for a hard copy book through Amazon, this extra bit of help means that I will be able to order some copies of the book to give out to bookstores and libraries locally. It will also allow me to sell copies at local author events, and through other venues. The money will also be used to sign up for services that will make it possible for me to get the book included in bookstore catalogs in major chains like Chapters-Indigo in Canada and Barnes & Noble in the US.This will make it easier for more people living with Crohn's disease and IBS to find and benefit from it. 

The Perk: If I reach this goal, I will publish a blooper reel of mistakes and funny things that happen while recording the video cookbook. 

Stretch Goal the Fourth -$2000 – Call me Professor Onion.

This money will be used to help set up classes at places like community centers, universities, and local colleges to offer starter cooking classes to people who want to learn. To start it would be mostly around Ottawa and surrounding areas, with possible trips to places like Kingston, Toronto, and Montreal.

The classes will include lessons to teach people how to can and preserve local food at home. This will allow people to support local farmers and save money at the same time. 

It will also make it possible for me to start to put together an in-home party style class for people who want to get together with friends to learn how to make a cool dish.

The Perk: If you are local, you will get free attendance at one of any of the classes, and depending on your donation level may even win you the chance to host a cooking party for a food of your choice. I will basically cook you dinner, and show you how I did it - For Free! 

Stretch Goal the Fifth - $10,000  – Take this Show on the Road!

If I reach this goal, (or more) I will pack up my car with some of my gadgets and goodies, along with boxed copies of my book, and take the act on the road. I will visit provinces and states throughout Canada and the US and demonstrate some of my fun cooking techniques as well as sell copies of my book. 

I will record the whole trip on my blog, including making videos of the different places I visit. The more money I raise, the more possibilities there are for where I can go and what I can do. 

The Perk: If you live in any of the places where I am able to visit, you will get free attendance at any of the classes, and depending on your donation level may even win you the chance to host a cooking party for a food of your choice. I will basically cook you dinner, and show you how I did it - For Free.

story:
VALA energy gels were created for the endurance athlete that seeks a completely natural and plant based energy source. Free from artificial preservatives, additives and refined sugars, VALA gels offer a source of natural energy that's gentle on the digestive system. We're big believers in the connection between physical health, gut health and mental health and VALA bridges the gap between all three.

Frustrated by the lack of natural gel alternatives available in the UK, founder Gem Wilson resolved to create a gel that could fuel her partner during his marathon runs (see our 'Meet The Founder' section below for more information). After hearing the same frustrations from fellow athletes and realising the market demand, she began recipe testing and established VALA. 

Using a unique blend of dates, maple syrup, lemon juice, lime juice, matcha tea powder and Halen Môn Welsh sea salt, VALA delivers a sweet yet refreshing hit. As a natural gel, VALA has a slightly thicker consistency than most shop-bought gels and is naturally golden caramel in colour.

We've created a high-carb gel that not only tastes great but actually works - see our athlete testimonials below. VALA can be eaten straight from the sachet when running, swimming, hiking or cycling and mixed with water or coconut water for an easy-to-consume sports drink on the go. VALA also tastes delicious blended into smoothies, squeezed onto porridge or drizzled on top of your favourite yoghurt.

VALA encourages athletes to make the natural choice, which is why our name is derived from the Welsh name meaning ‘chosen’. Born out of South Wales, UK, we’re proudly British and passionately support British suppliers and factories. VALA will be Informed Sport approved in order to give professional athletes complete confidence.  

VALA is created from whole foods to keep athletes naturally fuelled on their endurance exercise pursuits. Inspired by the Ayurvedic diet - which promotes healing through whole foods - we've formulated a gel that tastes like real food with real benefits. 

Our unique recipe not only tastes delicious but also has a positive impact on gut health. By using nature's resources and blending them together in one sachet, VALA is a convenient way to consume natural foods during exercise.

Dates and maple syrup provide a high carb content to replenish glycogen stores and reduce energy crashes. Our formula contains a high sugar content from dates and maple syrup, as well as citric acids from lemon and lime, which act as natural preservatives.   

Key benefits of VALA's ingredients:

Lemon juice - High in vitamin C and contains several essential electrolytes, including potassium, which is crucial for proper muscle function.

Dates - Date sugars are easily digested and can be immediately moved to the blood after consumption. Dates can be quickly metabolised to release energy, making them ideal for endurance sports.

Maple syrup - Contains a blend of sucrose and fructose, which are easily absorbed by the body. These are essential for a quick burst of energy when exercising.

Matcha tea - Aids with fat oxidation and metabolic efficiency, which saves the carbohydrates stores. Matcha tea preserves glycogen stores by helping to burn fat as fuel and includes natural caffeine.

Chia seeds - These produce a gel-forming action, which slows the conversion of carbohydrates into sugar, allowing the body to be be fuelled for longer periods of time.

Lime juice - Helps to eliminate excess acids from the body, including lactic acid. Boosts immune system and is packed with antibacterial properties.

Sea salt - Regulates water content both inside and outside of cells, creating an electrolyte balance and increasing hydration. 

Don't just take our word for it. VALA has been given the thumbs up by GB athletes, sports journalists and coaches. 

"As a triathlon coach, I get asked a lot about training and race nutrition. It’s not easy to answer due to the various ingredients in gels and how an athlete will respond to them. How you react to a gel can make or break your day. VALA is 100% natural, tastes delicious and has the energy boost that athletes need."

Rich Emmett, GB Triathlete and award-winning coach at Emmporia Triathlon Coaching - @emmporiatriathlon

 

"I'm a big believer in finding natural ways to fuel my training and my racing. Good nutrition shouldn't stop when you hit the start line. As part of my job as a running journalist, I've also tested a huge range of gels and VALA stands out as something different. The great balance of natural flavours and a real-food texture creates a source of fuel that you actually want to eat, rather than something you just put up with as a means to and end. On ultra runs I've often carried dates as a natural fuel source and these take that but put into an easier-to-carry format."

Kieran Alger, marathon runner and freelance journalist (Runner's World, Men's Fitness, The Guardian) - @manvmiles

 

 

"As a mountain biker, I need to keep my energy up on the trails. I use VALA gels because they're healthy, vegan-friendly and not only do they taste amazing, but they really help to give me a boost when I need it most."

Jess Strange, mountain biker, coach and freelance journalist - @velomejess

Each pledge gets us one step closer to making VALA a reality and we appreciate every backer. Our rewards are named after our favourite mountains, forests and beaches in South Wales. If you're based overseas but still want to back our campaign, you can use the 'donation' tool to contribute an amount that suits you.

All pledges will be shipped with an exclusive VALA sticker pack designed by Cardiff-based illustrator Lucy Dickson - @lucy__dickson, so you can rep VALA on your phone, laptop or gear.  

VALA apparel is created from technical fabric to ensure that you're always kept cool and dry. This includes our embroidered waterproof and breathable ripstop nylon cap and Neoteric™ fabric sports tee, which features a front logo and our brand mantra 'KEEP IT REAL' at the nape of the neck.   

We've teamed up with virtual training program Virtual Athlete to offer passes to their diverse virtual challenges. Claim yours when you pledge over £1,000.  

Virtual Athlete allows athletes to stay in shape with varied sports and difficulties using their virtual training challenges. Pick the challenge that suits you and complete it in one go, or many smaller efforts. These include 'Row the Bristol Channel', 'London to Paris Cycle' and 'Underground Ultramarathon'. Upon completion of their challenge, Virtual Athletes will receive a medal bespoke to each challenge in the mail. A 20% charity donation is made on behalf of all Virtual Athletes when they participate in any challenge.

VALA is the first gel of its kind to be manufactured in the UK without the addition of preservatives or rice bran syrup and as a result, we require custom machinery to be built in order to manufacture our gels. All of our factories, machinery manufacturers and suppliers are British based and we're working with BRC approved facilities.

Your pledge will help us to cover our manufacturing and production costs, as well as costly legal fees. These include global trademarking and business insurance, which will ensure that VALA can reach athletes across the world. 

We aim to get VALA in the hands of athletes by the end of May 2020, so that they can be used throughout a summer of training for their sport of choice. Due to pending laboratory shelf-life tests, we are yet to release complete nutritional values.     

We’re passionate about the positive impact that exercise has on mental health. That’s why we're aiming to donate a percentage of profits towards providing subsidised exercise classes in south Wales and promoting the benefits of exercise as a natural mood enhancer.  

 

"Hi, I'm Gem and I'm the founder of VALA. Shortly after meeting my partner in Australia, we began running together at the end of our long working days. Enjoying the release and structure that exercise gave him, he quickly began training for marathons. Before his long runs, I watched him consuming preservative-packed and chemical-laden gels that were full of maltodextrin, over-processed syrups and acesulfame k. It seemed that exercising as act of love for his mind and body was being undone by these artificial gels and the numerous additives that they included. I resolved to change this and began making him gels from all natural ingredients.

A year later we moved back to London and after many positive reviews from athletes that had sampled VALA, I left my career as an Art Director in advertising to focus on VALA full-time. I have recently returned to Wales to build VALA and qualify as a personal trainer, so that I can begin offering free training to promote the benefits of exercising for mental health. Thanks so much for your support - it means the world to us."

If you're unable to pledge, you can show us some love on socials and share our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.

Keep it touch and follow us on Instagram @valaenergy or sign up to the mailing list at valaenergy.com.

We really do value our backers as this wouldn’t be possible without your loyal support. If you have any questions, want to say hey or join us for a run/swim/ride in our stunning Welsh landscape, drop us a line at contact@valaenergy.com. We'd love to hear from you.

We already have our factories, machinery, suppliers and legal representatives lined up, therefore we can go into production shortly after receiving backing. Shelf life testing accounts for a large portion of the timeline from January until March, as we want to ensure that VALA is shelf safe for athletes for as long as possible. We currently expect to ship our gels by the end of May 2020. 

Please note that our shipping fees do not include customs fees and the backer will be liable for paying these on receipt of their delivery. Our shipping costs cover shipping materials as well as shipping, to ensure that VALA reaches you in perfect condition.

Potential delays that may occur include supplier, machinery, manufacturing and legal delays. However, we’re in constant contact with our contractors to ensure a seamless manufacturing process. We aim to be as transparent as possible and will keep you up-to-date every step, stroke and pedal of the way. We guarantee that you’ll be the first to see our gels come off the production line.

VALA has been given the thumbs up by GB athletes, sports journalists and coaches. "As a triathlon coach, I get asked a lot about training and race nutrition. It’s not easy to answer due to the various ingredients in gels and how an athlete will respond to them. How you react to a gel can make or break your day. VALA is 100% natural, tastes delicious and has the energy boost that athletes need."Rich Emmett, GB Triathlete and award-winning coach at Emmporia Triathlon Coaching - @emmporiatriathlon "I'm a big believer in finding natural ways to fuel my training and my racing. Good nutrition shouldn't stop when you hit the start line. As part of my job as a running journalist, I've also tested a huge range of gels and VALA stands out as something different. The great balance of natural flavours and a real-food texture creates a source of fuel that you actually want to eat, rather than something you just put up with as a means to and end. On ultra runs I've often carried dates as a natural fuel source and these take that but put into an easier-to-carry format."Kieran Alger, marathon runner and freelance journalist (Runner's World, Men's Fitness, The Guardian) - @manvmiles  "As a mountain biker, I need to keep my energy up on the trails. I use VALA gels because they're healthy, vegan-friendly and not only do they taste amazing, but they really help to give me a boost when I need it most."Jess Strange, mountain biker, coach and freelance journalist - @velomejessEach pledge gets us one step closer to making VALA a reality and we appreciate every backer. Our rewards are named after our favourite mountains, forests and beaches in South Wales. If you're based overseas but still want to back our campaign, you can use the 'donation' tool to contribute an amount that suits you.All pledges will be shipped with an exclusive VALA sticker pack designed by Cardiff-based illustrator Lucy Dickson - @lucy__dickson, so you can rep VALA on your phone, laptop or gear.  VALA apparel is created from technical fabric to ensure that you're always kept cool and dry. This includes our embroidered waterproof and breathable ripstop nylon cap and Neoteric™ fabric sports tee, which features a front logo and our brand mantra 'KEEP IT REAL' at the nape of the neck.   We've teamed up with virtual training program Virtual Athlete to offer passes to their diverse virtual challenges. Claim yours when you pledge over £1,000.  Virtual Athlete allows athletes to stay in shape with varied sports and difficulties using their virtual training challenges. Pick the challenge that suits you and complete it in one go, or many smaller efforts. These include 'Row the Bristol Channel', 'London to Paris Cycle' and 'Underground Ultramarathon'. Upon completion of their challenge, Virtual Athletes will receive a medal bespoke to each challenge in the mail. A 20% charity donation is made on behalf of all Virtual Athletes when they participate in any challenge.VALA is the first gel of its kind to be manufactured in the UK without the addition of preservatives or rice bran syrup and as a result, we require custom machinery to be built in order to manufacture our gels. All of our factories, machinery manufacturers and suppliers are British based and we're working with BRC approved facilities.Your pledge will help us to cover our manufacturing and production costs, as well as costly legal fees. These include global trademarking and business insurance, which will ensure that VALA can reach athletes across the world. We aim to get VALA in the hands of athletes by the end of May 2020, so that they can be used throughout a summer of training for their sport of choice. Due to pending laboratory shelf-life tests, we are yet to release complete nutritional values.     We’re passionate about the positive impact that exercise has on mental health. That’s why we're aiming to donate a percentage of profits towards providing subsidised exercise classes in south Wales and promoting the benefits of exercise as a natural mood enhancer.  

 
"Hi, I'm Gem and I'm the founder of VALA. Shortly after meeting my partner in Australia, we began running together at the end of our long working days. Enjoying the release and structure that exercise gave him, he quickly began training for marathons. Before his long runs, I watched him consuming preservative-packed and chemical-laden gels that were full of maltodextrin, over-processed syrups and acesulfame k. It seemed that exercising as act of love for his mind and body was being undone by these artificial gels and the numerous additives that they included. I resolved to change this and began making him gels from all natural ingredients.A year later we moved back to London and after many positive reviews from athletes that had sampled VALA, I left my career as an Art Director in advertising to focus on VALA full-time. I have recently returned to Wales to build VALA and qualify as a personal trainer, so that I can begin offering free training to promote the benefits of exercising for mental health. Thanks so much for your support - it means the world to us."If you're unable to pledge, you can show us some love on socials and share our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.Keep it touch and follow us on Instagram @valaenergy or sign up to the mailing list at valaenergy.com.We really do value our backers as this wouldn’t be possible without your loyal support. If you have any questions, want to say hey or join us for a run/swim/ride in our stunning Welsh landscape, drop us a line at contact@valaenergy.com. We'd love to hear from you.We already have our factories, machinery, suppliers and legal representatives lined up, therefore we can go into production shortly after receiving backing. Shelf life testing accounts for a large portion of the timeline from January until March, as we want to ensure that VALA is shelf safe for athletes for as long as possible. We currently expect to ship our gels by the end of May 2020. Please note that our shipping fees do not include customs fees and the backer will be liable for paying these on receipt of their delivery. Our shipping costs cover shipping materials as well as shipping, to ensure that VALA reaches you in perfect condition.Potential delays that may occur include supplier, machinery, manufacturing and legal delays. However, we’re in constant contact with our contractors to ensure a seamless manufacturing process. We aim to be as transparent as possible and will keep you up-to-date every step, stroke and pedal of the way. We guarantee that you’ll be the first to see our gels come off the production line.

story:
The brain child of Kevin and Ryan Muccular , That’s My Dog was designed with a simple goal in mind: To deliver quality gourmet Hot Dogs featuring Award Winning flavor to the Bay Area and beyond. This dynamic duo is not your average business owner. Ryan’s tenure in the field of Culinary Arts and Hospitality Management coupled with Kevin’s historical ties to some of California’s finest cooks make them the perfect team to bring “That’s My Dog” to life. Committed to providing a cost conscious menu while creating throw-back nostalgia, That’s My Dog is certain to become a household name and foodie favorite.

TMD is a local Bay Area operation that provides community members with fresh, quality and affordable gourmet hot dogs and delectable desserts. Coupled with their passion for great food it is their desire to help bring families together through their love of delicious food. To accomplish this TMD will develop a special recipe book that can be purchased by supporters. The money gained from the indiegogo campaign will enable TMD to conduct the research needed to develop this cookbook of recipes featuring items specially designed for That’s My Dog. The objective of the recipe book is to provide families with the resources to recreate some of their favorite past time meals at home with loved ones.

Additionally, That's My Dog is an organization that firmly believes in giving back to those less fortunate. 3% of all proceeds made through sales and financial contributions will be donated to local organizations geared towards improving the lives of under-served populations in the Bay Area.

story:
About Silber Brewing Company

We are four Certified Cicerones® aiming to bring innovative beers to Boerne, Texas and the surrounding Texas Hill Country. Together, we have experience in brewing, taproom management, customer service, and marketing. It has been a dream of ours to open a craft brewery for many years and this campaign is the last step in making Silber Brewing Company a reality. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign we are trying to reach a goal of $10,000. We have been a self-funded brewery up until this point, so the extra funds will help us out a great deal. Once the campaign is finalized, we will use this money to purchase items, such as tables, chairs, and entertainment for our taproom space, as well as more ingredients and barrels for creating and aging our beers.

For each donation, we are giving away different "perks" to say THANK YOU for supporting our dream! However, if you aren't interested in receiving perks but would like to donate, simply click the "Back It" button to the right of our video above.

 

Solera Club Membership

Below is a description of our $100 Brewery Membership:

  • Personalized 20oz Engraved Glass (4oz of free beer every pour!)
  • Unique members only t-shirt
  • Membership card, which you must show to receive benefits
  • 10% Off Merchandise
  • One 64oz glass growler
  • Stickers
  • Free pint on birthday
  • Participate in club only events

Rules:

  • Must be 21+
  • Expires yearly and must be renewed to continue benefits
  • Benefits apply only to member and not to any other person
  • Personal glasses must remain at brewery until end of yearly membership when they can be brought home or membership can be renewed for a discounted price
  • For glasses: You break you buy, we break we buy
  • We can revoke membership without refund due to refusal of brewery policies
  • We can change benefits at any time but will notify through email

 

*Some perks or parts of perks may not be available until the brewery is open and operating.  We will ship everything we can, as fast as we can and we appreciate your patience.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't feel bad if you can't donate money... we totally understand! We just ask that you please share this campaign with everyone you know.

Follow us on Instagram. https://www.instagram.com/silberbrewing/

Like us on Facebook. http://www.facebook.com/silberbrewing/

Please SHARE SHARE SHARE and help us reach our goal!

story:
Shipping is planned by end of June!

*Please note: Throttle Opener will be moving off Indiegogo once shipping begins, take advantage of early bird pricing before it's too late. Order NOW to get Throttle Opener up to 35% below expected retail price.*

Throttle | (noun) | throt·tle - The mechanism by which fluid flow is managed.

Design

Minimal and different...that was the goal. There are some wonderful openers that poke holes in cans or double as a tool, this is not one of them. Removing screwdrivers and accessories was essential to create a bottle opener that can sit discreetly anywhere and still be efficient. Although compact, it’s never hard to find. Throttle Opener sticks to any magnetic surface due to the built-in powerful rare earth magnet and has a bottle shaped hole large enough for a key-ring. Keep Throttle Opener on your key chain or anywhere you like to enjoy a cold one.

Choice of Finish: Natural, Smoke and Copper!

  • Mix and match finishes, pick a three pack or greater to get all 3. 
  • Free shipping in the US and discounted shipping anywhere in the world.
  • Big savings over expected retail price.

Manufacturing

Throttle Opener went through many versions. Because of 3D printing, I could quickly test and redesign to fine tune the look and function. After 3D printing in plastic,  I printed in steel to fully test the opener and get valuable feedback. Next, I found a manufacturer and order two openers that were made by machining sold pieces of steel, these were used for the images on this page. The two parts allowed me to test the quality of work from the manufacturer, but to also show buyers exactly what they would be receiving and eliminate some uncertainty that comes with crowd funding projects.

Throttle Opener will be made by pouring molten steel into molds, when cooled it will be sand blasted, brushed and then chrome plated in your choice of finish, natural, smoke or copper. Once I receive the openers I will attach a super strong rare earth magnet. I use a two part adhesive consisting of an epoxy resin and a hardener which is rated to hold up to 3,200 psi on non-flexible materials. Additionally, I have had prototypes over a year and have never had a problem; I have also tried to remove the magnets from the current prototypes without success.

Why Indiegogo InDemand

You Spoke, I Listened.Throttle Opener is here today because of the awesome feedback I received over the past year. Comments from sites such as Reddit and Kickstarter helped to validate the demand and give design suggestions, such as using steel instead of aluminum and to add a keyring hole. I am looking forward the to interacting with community from Indiegogo, another amazing group of early adopters that values unique designs and is willing to support a brand new product!

Please share this project with your friends on Facebook with the Indiegogo share tools.

 

Risks & Challenges

Prototypes showing the finishing options and key-ring hole were machined but the final openers will be produced via investment casting. All work will be done by the same company so the quality and finishes have been tested.

About Me

I have always loved learning, overcoming challenges and solving problems. My curiosity led me to explore 3D modeling and printing, for the first time I could see and touch products that had been trapped in my imagination.

I believe that there is so much left to be invented and improved upon, that today the tools exist for anyone to invent solutions and share them with the world.

Please share this project with your friends on Facebook with the Indiegogo share tools.

Music used in the video: I Dunno by Grapes is licensed under a Creative Commons Licence.http://bit.ly/1IBxcWb

story:
Introducing the Napoli Multi-Fueled Outdoor Pizza Oven. Our goal is to bring the most highest quality and easiest to use authentic multi-fueled outdoor pizza oven to everyone at an affordable price! At 900 degrees Fahrenheit, it can cook a Neapolitan pizza in less than 90 seconds.

Typical wood fired ovens are extremely expensive, take up a lot of space, and are not portable. The Napoli Multi-Fueled Outdoor Pizza oven is the solution to this problem. The Napoli is the most affordable, high quality, portable, multi-fueled outdoor pizza oven available. In addition to pizza, you can cook a wide variety of foods, including meat, fish, vegetables and dessert pizzas. This oven is extremely fun and addictive to use, provides amazing tasty Charcoal cooked, gas cooked, or Wood Fired results. This oven is lightweight and extremely portable, allowing you to take it with you to virtually any outdoor setting. Achieve restaurant quality results in your own backyard with the Napoli Multi-fueled outdoor pizza oven!

Being able to at temperatures of over 900 degrees Fahrenheit (much hotter than your standard in house oven) allows you to achieve a crisp outside, tender inside and perfect crust.

So Why Choose the Napoli?

Typical outdoor pizza ovens are large, non-portable and can cost thousands of dollars. 

Competitors that do offer smaller portable ovens, typically offer only one source of fuel for heating the oven, such as wood pellets. The Napoli Oven is multi-fueled, which means you can use wood pellets, charcoal, wood or gas. Competitors that do offer multi-fueled ovens charge over $600 for their units. During this campaign, you will have the opportunity to purchase the Napoli Multi-Fueled Pizza Oven for less than half that price, starting with our early bird special at $349! Also, competitors will use thin sheet metal walls, floor and ceiling. The Napoli uses thick fully insulated walls, ceiling and floor, with an overall superior build quality to any other portable multi-fueled oven on the market!

The fuels that can be used are your choice of:

  • Propane

  • Wood, Charcoal or Wood Pellets (Below is the new updated tray. It is now larger and can accommodate more pellets, charcoal and larger pieces of wood)

Insert the wood tray through the front of the oven and slide it to the back of the oven

 

Because it is multi-fueled, you have the ultimate flexibility to cook a wide variety of foods at a multitude of temperatures.

  • Pizza

  • Meat and Vegetables

  • Fish

  • Vegetables

You can do it all with the Napoli Multi-Fueled Outdoor Pizza Oven. You don't even need a grill!

The Napoli is lightweight and portable allowing you to bring it with you to virtually any outdoor setting. 

What you see in these pictures and videos is our prototype, which shows a functional version of the Napoli. The production version will have all of these features that we have tested to ensure we are offering you the highest quality, functional oven.

We have identified important features that will ensure the high quality and functionality you will want in your oven. Some important features include:

  • Corrugated bottom to prevent warping from heat

Corrugated flooring

Corrugated floor to prevent warping of floor due to high heat

  • Insulated walls, ceiling and flooring

Cross section with baking stone

Front view with logo

Side view

Below are technical drawings, showing the design process

Corrugated insulated floor to prevent warping. Durable legs added to the base. The legs fold in to allow for easier transport of the oven.

Back inner shell added and access doors.

Back outer shell added, with insulation between the two layers. Back access upper hatch for loading/igniting wood or charcoal. Lower access opening for removable wood/charcoal tray and gas attachment.

Inner main body shell added. 

Outer main body shell added with insulation between the two layers.

Front panel added.

Removable door for back end upper access hatch

We have built multiple iterations of our prototype and we have tested and tweaked the design with each version. The version that we will build for you will be simple, fast and effective for cooking outdoors.

Our prototype is showing you we are ready to go to market with a quality product. You are going to get a polished version of what you see. Believe!

Dimensions (approximate)  

Height 7 in. and 10.5 in. with legs  

Width - 14 in. Depth - 21.375 in.  

Opening - 3.125 in. tall by 12.5 in. wide  

Pizza stone size - 12.375 in. wide by 13.5 in. deep  

Weight - 21 lbs.  

We are ready to begin tooling, so this will aide in the timeline of product delivery.

story:
Overview 

Having good food options is at the core of building a healthier and happier lifestyle and being that plant-based eating is showing monumental results in healing people, we offer the food people already love and choose to eat in a fast and casual setting.

That’s where SomethinGood To Eat comes in. The restaurant serves plant-based versions of fast-food favorites, with the menu including “Good Nuggets” (a chickpea-based substitute for chicken nuggets), “Royal Burgers” (black bean burgers), “Good Burgers” (lentil burgers), and other items like barbecue jackfruit sandwiches, sweet potato fries and more. On the beverage menu, SomethinGood To Eat offers smoothshakes -- a cross between smoothies and milkshakes, using house-made oat milk. Recognizing that SomethinGood is sometimes hard to find with the overwhelming amount of options in this world, we wanted to cut through the noise and make finding something good simpler.

 

How the Money Will be Used 

So Far SomethinGood has been all self-funded, We were mostly making everything that will be on the menu at home, every day, for the last few years. It got to a point where it was the right direction to make this a public offering because many people were struggling to find easy access to healthy options whether they were plant-based or omnivorous. We currently have a space we are developing in the heart of Cleveland Larchmere district. We hope to purchase new equipment, produce marketing collateral, and continue to grow our business, and help people through food. We have some amazing rewards for campaign patrons! If you're unable able to support financially, please consider sharing our campaign!

 

The Perks

This first run of t-shirts and products are designed for our launch. See the perks to the right and select the one that is right for you. All prices include shipping.

Having good food options is at the core of building a healthier and happier lifestyle and being that plant-based eating is showing monumental results in healing people, we offer the food people already love and choose to eat in a fast and casual setting.
That’s where SomethinGood To Eat comes in. The restaurant serves plant-based versions of fast-food favorites, with the menu including “Good Nuggets” (a chickpea-based substitute for chicken nuggets), “Royal Burgers” (black bean burgers), “Good Burgers” (lentil burgers), and other items like barbecue jackfruit sandwiches, sweet potato fries and more. On the beverage menu, SomethinGood To Eat offers smoothshakes -- a cross between smoothies and milkshakes, using house-made oat milk. Recognizing that SomethinGood is sometimes hard to find with the overwhelming amount of options in this world, we wanted to cut through the noise and make finding something good simpler.
 

How the Money Will be Used 
So Far SomethinGood has been all self-funded, We were mostly making everything that will be on the menu at home, every day, for the last few years. It got to a point where it was the right direction to make this a public offering because many people were struggling to find easy access to healthy options whether they were plant-based or omnivorous. We currently have a space we are developing in the heart of Cleveland Larchmere district. We hope to purchase new equipment, produce marketing collateral, and continue to grow our business, and help people through food. We have some amazing rewards for campaign patrons! If you're unable able to support financially, please consider sharing our campaign!
 

The Perks
This first run of t-shirts and products are designed for our launch. See the perks to the right and select the one that is right for you. All prices include shipping.

story:
Short Summary

Hullo, My name is John Sseggirinya,  Team leader Water The Growers -WAGRO , A group of youths in Uganda. This group has been created now for 2 years.

    Water The Growers – WAGRO is a registered youth group under the auspices of a Non – Governmental Organization called Training of Rural Women in Uganda – TORUWU established in the year 2000 and registered under an NGO ACT No. S 5914/3718.

    Our mission is to empower the youth with social and economic growth so that they can always pave their way to success in this fast growing world.

    WAGRO performs its activities under the multi- disciplinary Board of TORUWU. WAGRO operates through the main Headquarters of TORUWU covering 10 villages. It is a group of 50 youths who benefit directly with a team of competent staff members.

    WAGRO targets unemployed youths, HIV/AIDS infected youths, non – school going children and other vulnerable children.

    Mainly Our Campaign is :

    To fully establish our wine Project and allocate the profits to the youths  Fruit Tree  project, We need to produce 1000 litres. 

    As a starting cost, we shall struggle and raise $ 2,800, Which is our goal never easy but we must try our best. 

    With your help, increasing this wine will benefit about 50 youths because the profits will be used to fund other programs like fruit tree growing, developing Job skills, entrepreneurial skills, educational attainment, career development, environmental conservation and build personal Growth. These areas are essential to any person’s ability to be independent and productive. The youth enrolled will serve and actively participate in their community as part of youths projects.

    Here below is the budget:

    Even if we don't reach our target we shall use the money to increase the productions. Thanks so much.

    Don't miss out on our beautiful Perks, these perks are individually craft hand made  by the youths .

    The Impact

    The project has great impact on the employment of the youths and the environment. This will change lives of about 150 people indirectly, talk about their families and friends.

     

    We have produced wine for now 2 years but we have been investing some of the profits into educating school children on the importance of planting trees and doing away with Plastic Pollution. Which we have done quite successfully now with your help we shall use the profits more  into creating gardens of fruit trees which will be sold locally to earn the youths still and boost the group's activities.

     

    Risks & Challenges

    To avoid misuse of these funds the following will be done:

    1. A bank account will separately be opened specifically for this campaign this is to ensure these Funds are used appropriately. Mr . Yiga and Ms. Sophie of Training Of Rural Women In Uganda - TORUWU will be the principal signatories of this account since its our Umbrella organisation.

    2. The stock produced must be kept the same.

    3. An agreement to be signed that the money got should only and only be used for its intent.

     The youths are highly committed to producing and developing this project to the heights because its want feeds them.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can also help by sharing our campaign with a friend or someone you know can be of help.

    or If you think of any other way you can email us.

    Tell a friend to tell a friend.

    In conclusion,

    I want to share with you some of the messages some of the customers have shared with us.

    Nakidde Carol gave us thumbs up,When she tasted the wine and said:

    this wine is isanely classy i love it.

    A friend in Colorado Natasha Isimbi stated that wine is good she will have a friend who is in Uganda currently return with a bottle or two in February

    Lets do this I believe we can... thank you so much. we are strong and determined to achive this

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
My mom was a multi-passionate woman, who loved, music, acupuncture, people, the earth, nature, and farming.

She continually worked to educate and help people to come to a better state of life and healing.

Unfortunately, she herself succumbed to cancer two weeks ago.

There is one project I desire to make a reality, her homeopathic poison ivy cream.

She had finished the logo, and had received testimonials from people who used it and found that it relieved their symptoms very quickly.

She just needed to finish making a business entity, gathering funds to produce her first batch of creams(the first batch requires her to make at least 1000 units) as well as get the proper insurance and FDA approvals.

Her illness took over and she passed away before she could do this.

I have a desire to complete this project for her.

I always said (and my dad did too) that my mom had a head for helping people but not for business.

She was like an idea gun, always excited, making new connections, meeting people and learning about new things.

I would love to see her product be produced and eventually distributed. Maybe even becoming a household name.

Seeing it on the shelves in a store like Whole Foods would make me feel like I was able to make one of her dreams come true.

It would be a physical reminder of her love and passion and the continuation of her legacy of helping the earth.

story:
Hello! Let me introduce myself....

I'm Pru, the one woman show behind Ayni  Creatively Paleo Chocolate. 

The photo on the left is me in 2010, when I was bordering on obese, suffering from terrible asthma and anaemia along with a host of other health issues. The photo on the right is me in 2014, 3 years into a paleo diet no longer suffering from asthma, anaemia and no longer overweight!


Why Are Paleo and Allergy Free Chocolates Important?

If you know or love someone with an allergy or food intolerance you will know how difficult (often impossible!) it can be to find delicious chocolates to gift them with.  
Allergies and food intolerances can make life difficult, and being denied one of life's greatest pleasures can REALLY get on your nerves, trust me, I know! I wanted to be able to eat great chocolates knowing that they weren't going to make me ill, and I wanted my husband to be able to buy me an exciting box of chocolates for Easter or Christmas. We looked, but there was nothing out there, so I had to create them myself.
 
Banoffee Bites  - my most popular chocolate to date

So far I've had 2 customers who have NEVER had a box of chocolates in their entire life, because of allergies. Those customers were absolutely over the moon to find that they could, for the first time ever, be indulged. One customer was so thrilled to be able to buy her husband his first ever box of chocolates she almost cried! It really is THAT life changing, crazy though it may seem if you are used to being able to buy any box of chocolates you desire.
More and more people are becoming aware of how their diet affects their health, but no matter how great you are at sticking to a hard core healthy eating plan, you are still going to want to factor in treats. My philosophy is that denying yourself treats is a sure fire route to misery; it's far better to know that you can choose treats that aren't going to make you ill than to binge eat the things that you know aren't good for you. 
All of our chocolates and bars are made without refined sugar, dairy, soy, nuts, sesame seeds, grains, gluten and eggs making them suitable for the vast majority of allergy sufferers - of course there will always be those who suffer from unusual allergies, and if I can, I will always do whatever I can to accommodate you - just talk to me.

The chocolate bars going out to my first supporters

Why do I think I can do this?

Firstly, because I already am! I just need to do it on a bigger scale, and that's where I need your help!

I've made chocolates for donkey's years, and dabbled in raw chocolate for a couple of years but this year I took courses from the world's greatest raw chocolatier, which increased my skill and knowledge massively.
On June 23rd this year I opened my little online chocolate shop for business, after being asked when my first product - mint creams - could be purchased. Since then I've invested in a small 2l stone grinder which has enabled me to create a lighter, more milk style chocolate which has opened up endless possibilities.
My customers have been very lovely and enthusiastic; a recent customer was so excited by my cherry creams that her response was practically X rated! 

A customised box of fruit creams in 70% cacao shells
I've just sent out my first wholesale order of 80 of my 70%  cacao raspberry bars.
I am taking my chocolates to two massive fairs - the Allergy and Free From Show North, in Liverpool in October, and the Country Living Christmas fair in Harrogate in November. 
So I think you would agree I'm the sort of person who gets things done!

Why do I need your help?

I  have big  ideas, on a shoestring budget, in a nutshell (or not, as we don't use any nut products in our chocolates). 


I know that there are 1000s of people out there who would really enjoy the opportunity to treat themselves (and be treated!) to a gorgeous box of exciting chocolates, if only they could find some that didn't contain a bazillion allergens! I want to be there to put the smile on their face, and the face of the friend or loved one who can FINALLY buy a longed for gift.  


I have inspiration, determination, skill, knowledge and love by the bucket load, but I also need cold, hard cash to make this dream come wildly alive. Do you dare to dream wildly with me? Come on then, read on...


What I Need

I'm looking to raise a big sum, I know that, but I'm absolutely certain that it can be done. 

Chocolate making is an expensive business, particularly when you are making it from scratch, and sourcing not so common ingredients. People expect a high level of smoothness from a chocolate bar, and unfortunately that requires machinery. I'm muddling along with a temperamental little 2l stone grinder right now, but realistically it's not up to the job I, and my customers, expect from it. So the bulk of the money will go in machinery:

  • A conch which will create uber smooth chocolate - just short of £6k 
  • A tempering machine which will keep the chocolate at a workable temperature saving me from having to keep melting and tempering every 20 minutes or so - £1600 
  • Fair costs - the two fairs I've booked to do will cost just over £1500 including all the insurances that are required. 
  • Packaging  and leaflets - £1k
  • Ingredients - bulk buying raw ingredients makes the process much more economical, but involves large quantities to benefit from the discounts - £1k should see me with enough to get through the two fairs, which should then generate enough income to plough back into more ingredients.
  • Advertising and website costs will take up the remainder. 

What you'll get

  • A warm fuzzy feeling from knowing you helped someone create an amazing product.
  • Did I mention chocolates? Lovely, lovely raw chocolates just for you.
  • Advertising for our sponsors on our leaflets and website. The combined footfall for both fairs is expected to be in the region of 20,000 people. We have a unique product which we expect to generate a lot of interest. 

Changing The World One Chocolate at a Time


Not only is Ayni Chocolate a fantastic thing for people with allergies and intolerances, and anyone looking for a healthier chocolate indulgence; Ayni is a socially responsible business - that's why I chose the name Ayni which is a Peruvian term which, essentially, means reciprocity - helping each other.  
  • 10% of profits go to Kiva loans, so that fellow entrepreneurs around the world can get the backing they need for their business.  
  • Extra fund raising products will channel money to worthy causes. This is already happening with our Justice for LB chocolate buses - read more here. We will also be launching our Boxes of Flowers shortly, with 10% of the retail price going to the Anthony Nolan Trust. 
  • As a family, we believe in looking after the world we live in; we will always use organic products wherever possible, and will use environmentally friendly processes and packaging at every available opportunity.
  • As a family, we value honest ingredient information, and think you deserve exactly the same, so you can trust us to give you the no nonsense details you need.

Other Ways You Can Help

Helping doesn't have to involve money! I would be so delighted if you helped by 
  • talking to your friends and family about Ayni Chocolate.
  • Tweeting and facebooking this campaign would help enormously in getting the word out - using the inbuilt share tools makes this so easy to do, just click and it's all done for you. 
  • Maybe you have a service or skill that could help me? Talk to me, I'm always open to ideas
  • Come and say hello if you're visiting either of the fairs I'll be at - it would make my day!

story:
Our Story

Looking to fill a void in the stagnant rye whiskey market, Air Force veteran Michael Manfredonia founded Gunnison Valley Distillery to bring the bold and unique flavor of malted rye to whiskey lovers across The Gunnison Valley, Colorado, and beyond.  Unlike other rye whiskey, 100% of our rye grain goes through the malting process - a process traditionally reserved for barley.  This break from tradition allows us to stand apart from other whiskey, while the rye grain provides instant familiarity.

Donating today allows us to continue our journey of bringing some delicious whiskey to Gunnison.  While our whiskey will continue to age without this campaign, it will do so out-of-state in a different climate - creating an entirely different taste than barrels aged in Gunnison.  Additionally, we won't be able to add additional barrels to our inventory, increasing the likelihood that this 2 year cycle will repeat itself once we are able to sell our current batch.

 

Our Needs

This is where we layout the crazy amount of money a project like this needs and where your dollars go.  All funds raised will go towards 3 primary categories:

  • More Whiskey
    • This includes more barrels, as well as the equipment and materials necessary to blend and bottle the whiskey once it finishes ageing
  • Renovations
    • Any property we lease will need significant upgrades to be approved for storage of whiskey barrels
    • We also need some chairs, a bar, and some decorations for the tasting room so you can sip and enjoy our whiskey in comfort
  • Shipping
    • Every barrel we fill needs to be delivered to our eventual warehouse

The exact dollar amounts for each of these categories is flexible, but we are estimating $20,000 for property renovations and $15,000 for shipping our barrels.  This leaves $40,000 for more barrels and a small bottling line.

 

What's in it for you

Every donation, no matter how big or small, means the world to us - and hopefully you as well.  But that doesn't mean we can't give you something in return for your generosity.  We are offering perks that range from $10 to $10,000 and provide something for every level of interest.

Drinks for Life!

That sounds awesome.  For residents of the valley, frequent visitors, or anyone that enjoys knowing where a free drink will be, a donation of $1000 ($1250 if you miss the early bird rate) makes you eligible for our feature perk.  2 free drinks per day for life.  Once our tasting room is open, as long as we have whiskey, you'll have a drink!

Drinks and Bottles

Of course, many people won't be able to donate that much, so we're also offering perks that include a bottle of whiskey or a single drink in the tasting room.

  • Voucher for a 2 year aged bottle of whiskey
    • For $55 (or $50 if early bird perks are still available) you can get a voucher good for our 100% rye malt whiskey, aged 2 years.
    • For $150, you can get one of our first 100 bottles.  These will be a completely different bottle style and come in a wood crate package to celebrate the area's rich mining history.
  • Voucher for a 4 year aged bottle of whiskey
    • Six of our barrels are being held for longer ageing - 4 years.  For an $85 donation, you can receive a voucher for one of these bottles.  These will be the first barrels of our ultimate flagship product line.
       

The Impact

Beyond all of the really cool perks you can choose from, why should you donate?  The answer is simple, community.  Our first step after this campaign is bringing our barrels to Gunnison, and then building out our tasting room.  With our whiskey on everyone's radar, locals and tourists alike are liable to spend more time where it matters - with each other and with Gunnison's small business community.

Colorado is well-known for being a leader in craft beer and is increasingly becoming known for craft spirits.  The Gunnison valley is well known for being one of the best spots in the state for outdoor recreation year-round.  Our distillery looks to marry these two institutions, providing a unique opportunity for tourists and locals alike to enjoy more of their interests and hobbies in-town.

 

Risks & Challenges

Starting a distillery is not without significant challenges.  Stills and other equipment are expensive, facilities need to be built to particular specifications due to the nature of high proof alcohol, and whiskey ageing takes time.  Additionally, moving to and living in the valley brings its own set of challenges - but also some amazing rewards and benefits.

With regards to this campaign, should we not raise enough money, we will still have the barrels we've already filled, but will have to find a new path to bringing them to Colorado, filling bottles, and entering into sales and distribution.  This path increases the likelihood of overall failure as it doesn't help us truly build the brand as a Gunnison-based product.

Our path to success starts with this campaign.  By raising the money we need to bring our barrels to Gunnison, we build that sense of community and stay true to the foundations this company was built on.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every bit helps.  This could be through donating, or through simply spreading the word about our campaign.  Whether you are able to donate or not, mention this to your friends and family, tell a neighbor, tell the next 4 people you see on the street.  It all helps.

Don't forget, you can always follow us on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook - and so can everyone you just told about our funding campaign.

So donate, or don't.  Tell your friends, or don't. Swing by our email or social media and say hi, or don't.  No matter what you do, we appreciate you and the time you've taken to get here.  So thank you.

Cheers.
story_txt:
Our Story
Looking to fill a void in the stagnant rye whiskey market, Air Force veteran Michael Manfredonia founded Gunnison Valley Distillery to bring the bold and unique flavor of malted rye to whiskey lovers across The Gunnison Valley, Colorado, and beyond.  Unlike other rye whiskey, 100% of our rye grain goes through the malting process - a process traditionally reserved for barley.  This break from tradition allows us to stand apart from other whiskey, while the rye grain provides instant familiarity.
Donating today allows us to continue our journey of bringing some delicious whiskey to Gunnison.  While our whiskey will continue to age without this campaign, it will do so out-of-state in a different climate - creating an entirely different taste than barrels aged in Gunnison.  Additionally, we won't be able to add additional barrels to our inventory, increasing the likelihood that this 2 year cycle will repeat itself once we are able to sell our current batch.
 

Our Needs
This is where we layout the crazy amount of money a project like this needs and where your dollars go.  All funds raised will go towards 3 primary categories:


More WhiskeyThis includes more barrels, as well as the equipment and materials necessary to blend and bottle the whiskey once it finishes ageing

Renovations
Any property we lease will need significant upgrades to be approved for storage of whiskey barrels
We also need some chairs, a bar, and some decorations for the tasting room so you can sip and enjoy our whiskey in comfort


ShippingEvery barrel we fill needs to be delivered to our eventual warehouse


The exact dollar amounts for each of these categories is flexible, but we are estimating $20,000 for property renovations and $15,000 for shipping our barrels.  This leaves $40,000 for more barrels and a small bottling line.
 
What's in it for you
Every donation, no matter how big or small, means the world to us - and hopefully you as well.  But that doesn't mean we can't give you something in return for your generosity.  We are offering perks that range from $10 to $10,000 and provide something for every level of interest.
Drinks for Life!
That sounds awesome.  For residents of the valley, frequent visitors, or anyone that enjoys knowing where a free drink will be, a donation of $1000 ($1250 if you miss the early bird rate) makes you eligible for our feature perk.  2 free drinks per day for life.  Once our tasting room is open, as long as we have whiskey, you'll have a drink!
Drinks and Bottles
Of course, many people won't be able to donate that much, so we're also offering perks that include a bottle of whiskey or a single drink in the tasting room.

Voucher for a 2 year aged bottle of whiskey
For $55 (or $50 if early bird perks are still available) you can get a voucher good for our 100% rye malt whiskey, aged 2 years.
For $150, you can get one of our first 100 bottles.  These will be a completely different bottle style and come in a wood crate package to celebrate the area's rich mining history.


Voucher for a 4 year aged bottle of whiskeySix of our barrels are being held for longer ageing - 4 years.  For an $85 donation, you can receive a voucher for one of these bottles.  These will be the first barrels of our ultimate flagship product line. 



The Impact
Beyond all of the really cool perks you can choose from, why should you donate?  The answer is simple, community.  Our first step after this campaign is bringing our barrels to Gunnison, and then building out our tasting room.  With our whiskey on everyone's radar, locals and tourists alike are liable to spend more time where it matters - with each other and with Gunnison's small business community.
Colorado is well-known for being a leader in craft beer and is increasingly becoming known for craft spirits.  The Gunnison valley is well known for being one of the best spots in the state for outdoor recreation year-round.  Our distillery looks to marry these two institutions, providing a unique opportunity for tourists and locals alike to enjoy more of their interests and hobbies in-town.
 

Risks & Challenges
Starting a distillery is not without significant challenges.  Stills and other equipment are expensive, facilities need to be built to particular specifications due to the nature of high proof alcohol, and whiskey ageing takes time.  Additionally, moving to and living in the valley brings its own set of challenges - but also some amazing rewards and benefits.
With regards to this campaign, should we not raise enough money, we will still have the barrels we've already filled, but will have to find a new path to bringing them to Colorado, filling bottles, and entering into sales and distribution.  This path increases the likelihood of overall failure as it doesn't help us truly build the brand as a Gunnison-based product.
Our path to success starts with this campaign.  By raising the money we need to bring our barrels to Gunnison, we build that sense of community and stay true to the foundations this company was built on.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Every bit helps.  This could be through donating, or through simply spreading the word about our campaign.  Whether you are able to donate or not, mention this to your friends and family, tell a neighbor, tell the next 4 people you see on the street.  It all helps.
Don't forget, you can always follow us on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook - and so can everyone you just told about our funding campaign.
So donate, or don't.  Tell your friends, or don't. Swing by our email or social media and say hi, or don't.  No matter what you do, we appreciate you and the time you've taken to get here.  So thank you.
Cheers.

story:
Hello! My name is Shay. I am the founder and owner of The Hungry Nerd! 

Here are some things that you should know about me. I'm 25 years old, originally form Washington, DC and currently living in Houston, TX. Also, I'm a nerd! A huge one! I love video games, comics, anime, movies (Disney, MCU, DC, etc.) and FOOD! So I decided to combine all of my passions into one. This is why I have started The Hungry Nerd. 

The Hungry Nerd is a food truck that offers your favorite foods that have been inspired by your favorite characters. We serve all those great foods you can only get at carnivals and more! All with a nerdy twist to them! 

This is food by geeks and nerds for nerds and geeks. Our mission is to serve the punniest and nerdiest food that we possible can and your contribution could help put a smile on a hungry nerds face that lays eyes and tastebuds on one of our awesome tasty menu items. 

 

HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTION HELPS:

We all know running a business isn't cheap. This is where your help comes in. We need a variety of different things to get started. Our goal is $50,000 to get started. Do not think you are alone in this campaign! We are constantly having fundraising events around Houston, TX so we can reach our goal even faster! However, lucky you gets a treat for your contributions! We know times are tough so just give what you can. Below are some things that we need to get started. 

 

  • Food Trailer with equipment
  • Supplies (Food)
  • Licensing and Fee's
  • Insurance
  • Commissary

 

THE PERKS:

Check in our perks section of the awesome gifts just as a thank you for your contribution.

 

MORE ABOUT US:

This all started as an idea to create more happiness in our community in the best way possible. By combining two things we hold dear to our hearts, food and nerdom! A lot of hard work and dedication has been put into this project and we are determined to see it succeed. We come from various backgrounds ranging from IT, culinary, and even business. All of this helps in everyday business needs for our food truck.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

With any knew business there are always risks. The best thing you can possibly do is be prepared. This is exactly what we have done. We have prepared safety nets for those first few months of business while we wait for customers. We have also secured a maintenance team for all of our equipment for our food truck/trailer. We are challenge seekers and conquerors. And we will never back down. Just level up!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

If you can't contribute monetarily, that's okay. We would appreciate a shoutout on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or even Snapchat! The more you share, the better! Thank you and remember, Stay Nerdy My Friends!

story:
Wine is simple! 

Support my quest to bring the wine world always  closer to you:

  • My name is Loic Carlier. I was born in France a few decades ago and I am passionate about wine since 2004 when I started to work with French producers.
  • Meanwhile, I expended the spectrum of my activities and started to focus more on wine tastings when I moved to Germany in 2011.
  • This campaign aims to support the creation of my very 1st Video Wine Guide! In the last 3 years, attendees of my many wine tastings have tasted & rated around 300 wines from 14 countries.
  • NOW IS TIME to gather and go into details about the very best of them!
  • This guide and the videos will help you get more information and advises for choosing the right wines!

What We Need is You!

Your active support will make it alive:

  • With a minimum of 2500€, I can hire a camera team and a graphic artist, and purchase all the necessary bottles of wine and accessories.
  • If we increase the target, I will also be able to start working on the second Video Wine Guide (Planned for November 2017 already!)
  • You can find a suitable perks to support this project: from showing your simple support up to becoming a main sponsor!
  • Should I not reach the target, I would still be able to finance the purchase of wines and make the shooting of the videos by myself...

Wine for everyone.

This project is the continuation of 3 years of simplifying the wine world:

  • Over the last 3 years and the many tastings we had, I helped people get closer to the wine world and understand it better. This guide will now continue that by making the wine be explained at home through a selection of the very best ones!
  • Everyone can taste wine and this guide will give you a starting point!

Spread the word!

Tell your friend about us:

  • Wein-Kollektion is organizing wine tasting communities & events all over Germany. Help us create more communities in your country! Contact us & open your local community!
  • Wein-Kollektion is also on YouTube! Follow the following link & Subscribe: WEINKOLLEKTION
  • Wein-Kollektion is on Facebook: www.facebook.com/weinkollektion
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools & Bring your friends in!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST & SUPPORT!
